name: tacos_al_pastor
instructions: make the marinade by blending the guajillo and ancho chiles with garlic, onion, pineapple juice, vinegar, orange juice, achiote paste, oregano, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and black pepper until smooth.
marinate the sliced pork shoulder in the mixture for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
preheat a grill or large skillet over medium-high heat.
cook the marinated pork and pineapple slices until charred and caramelized, about 3-4 minutes per side.
warm the tortillas on the grill or skillet.
assemble the tacos by placing pork and a piece of grilled pineapple on each tortilla.
top with diced onion, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.
notes: For the best flavor, marinate the pork overnight and grill over charcoal if possible.
